experiment_wrapper¶

The experiment_wrapper module creates a level of abstraction between the control of actual instruments and control of the entire experiment as a whole. For example, instead of initializing each instrument on its own and then setting settings like the lock-in reference input, the initialize_instruments() function does all of this automatically.

control.experiment_wrapper.get_chopper_amplitude()¶

Returns the chopper amplitude in volts.

control.experiment_wrapper.get_chopper_frequency()¶

Gets the chopper frequency in kHz.

Returns:The chopper frequency in kHz
control.experiment_wrapper.get_data()¶

Gets the recorded data as a numpy array.

Returns:A numpy array object with frequency in the first column and R in the second column
control.experiment_wrapper.get_freq_multiplier()¶

Returns the frequency multiplier, which can be changed depending on the experimental setup.

control.experiment_wrapper.get_freq_synth_enable()¶

Returns true if the frequency sythesizer is enabled, false otherwise.

control.experiment_wrapper.get_freq_synth_freq()¶

Returns the frequency in GHz.

control.experiment_wrapper.get_freq_synth_power()¶

Gets the power level of the frequency synthesizer in dBm.

control.experiment_wrapper.get_low_pass_slope()¶

Returns the current low pass filter slope of the lock-in in dB per octave.

Returns:The slope in dB per octave
control.experiment_wrapper.get_multimeter_dc_measurement()¶

Returns the DC voltage measured by the multimeter.

Returns:The DC voltage.
control.experiment_wrapper.get_sample_rate()¶

Returns the current sample rate of the lock-in in Hz.

Returns:The sample rate in Hz
control.experiment_wrapper.get_sensitivity()¶

Returns the current sensitivity of the lock-in in mV.

Returns:The sensitivity in mV
control.experiment_wrapper.get_time_constant()¶

Returns the current time constant of the lock-in in ms.

Returns:The sensitivity in ms
control.experiment_wrapper.get_time_to_fill()¶

Returns the time needed to fill storage in seconds.

Returns:The time needed to fill storage in seconds
control.experiment_wrapper.initialize()¶

Initializes the instruments and prepares the relevant settings.

control.experiment_wrapper.set_chopper_amplitude(amplitude=0.5)¶

Sets the chopper amplitude in volts.

Parameters:amplitude – The amplitude in volts
control.experiment_wrapper.set_chopper_frequency(freq=10)¶

Sets the chopper frequency in kHz.

Parameters:freq – The frequency in kHz
control.experiment_wrapper.set_chopper_on(turn_on=False)¶

Sets the chopper output on if turn_on is True.

Parameters:turn_on – Turns on if True
control.experiment_wrapper.set_data(col1='X', col2='Y')¶

Sets the data to record in columns 1 and 2.

Parameters:
  • col1 – Either ‘X’, ‘R’, ‘X noise’, ‘Aux1’, or ‘Aux2’
  • col2 – Either ‘Y’, ‘Theta’, ‘Y noise’, ‘Aux3’, or ‘Aux4’
control.experiment_wrapper.set_freq_multiplier(multiple=18)¶

Sets the frequency multiplier, which should be equal to the product of the frequency multipliers present in the experimental setup.

control.experiment_wrapper.set_freq_synth_enable(enable=False)¶

Turns the frequency synthesizer output on or off.

Parameters:enable – True if the frequency synthesizer should be on, false if off.
control.experiment_wrapper.set_freq_synth_frequency(freq=200)¶

Sets the frequency synthesizer to continuous wave mode at the specified frequency where units are in GHz. This will automatically divide the ranges by freq_multiple (as the source is attached to a set of frequency multipliers).

control.experiment_wrapper.set_freq_synth_power(power_level=0.0)¶

Sets the power level of the frequency synthesizer in dBm.

Parameters:power_level – The power level in dBm
control.experiment_wrapper.set_low_pass_slope(slope=18)¶

Sets the low pass filter slope of the lock-in in dB per octave. The lock-in has a set of allowed slopes. This method will choose the first allowed slope that is smaller than the one entered. If no allowed slope is smaller, 6dB per octave will be selected.

Parameters:slope – The preferred slope in dB per octave
Returns:The chosen slope in dB per octave
control.experiment_wrapper.set_sample_rate(sample_rate=512)¶

Sets the sample rate of the lock-in in Hz. The lock-in has a set of allowed sample rates. This method will choose the first allowed sample rate constant that is larger than the one entered.

Parameters:sample_rate – The preferred sample rate in Hz
Returns:The chosen time constant
control.experiment_wrapper.set_sensitivity(sensitivity=1000.0)¶

Sets the sensitivity of the lock-in in mV. The lock-in has a set of allowed sensitivities. This method will choose the first allowed sensitivity that is larger than the one entered.

Parameters:sensitivity – The preferred sensitivity in mV
Returns:The chosen sensitivity
control.experiment_wrapper.set_time_constant(time_constant=1000)¶

Sets the time constant of the lock-in in ms. The lock-in has a set of allowed time constants. This method will choose the first allowed time constant that is larger than the one entered.

Parameters:time_constant – The preferred time constant in ms
Returns:The chosen time constant
control.experiment_wrapper.snap_data()¶

Gets the current value in the X and Y readouts on the lock-in amplifier

Returns:A tuple of the form (x, y)
control.experiment_wrapper.start_scan()¶

Starts data collection. Returns the time needed to fill storage in seconds.

Returns:The time needed to fill storage in seconds
control.experiment_wrapper.stop_scan()¶

Stops the current scan.
